2012–2014 Élan Chalon

Career highlights and awards
  • Leaders Cup champion (2017)
  • French League All-Star (2017)

Billy Yakuba Ouattara (born January 24, 1992 in Tepa, Ghana), is a Ghanaian-French professional basketball player for the Brooklyn Nets of the National Basketball Association (NBA), on a two-way contract with the Nets' NBA G League affiliate, the Long Island Nets

Because of the unavailability of a Ghanaian national basketball team, he has been a member of the French national basketball team.[1]

Professional career[edit]

On July 24, 2015, Ouattara signed with AS Monaco Basket of the Pro A.[2]

Oattara signed a two-way contract with the Brooklyn Nets of the NBA on July 21, 2017. Under the terms of the deal, he will split time between the Nets and their G-League affiliate, the Long Island Nets.[3] He also became the first foreign born player to sign a two-way deal with an NBA team.
